answerText: Publius Papinius Statius[10] One of Statius's Silvae commemorates the death of this poet, who committed suicide after the Pisonian conspiracy failed and ended his Pharsalia with Caesar being attacked at a banquet held by Cleopatra.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Penn | 20 | Literature | Classical | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This author wrote a poem whose speaker tells its addressee that "some couple, bodies interlocked, Must shut your from their night-long ecstasy; So come to me." For 10 points each: [10] Name this author of "Ode to Sleep", part of his collection of thirty-two occasional poems in five books known as the Silvae.
